H0.text: The appearance of volcanoes at the boundaries where plates collide is the best evidence for the theory of continental drift.

H1.text: Earthquakes at boundaries where one plate slides past another are the best evidence for the theory of continental drift.

H2.text: Cases where a species exists in only one isolated place are the best evidence for the theory of continental drift.

H3.text: Fossils of the same species found on widely separated continents serve as the best evidence for the theory of continental drift.

A4.text: He noticed that there was a significant similarity between matching sides of the continents, especially in fossil plants.
